list.name: Turkey President Curtis
list.about: In the Rick and Morty episode 'The Rickchurian Mortydate,' Turkey President Curtis is portrayed as a corrupt politician who is secretly a humanoid robot controlled by a sentient turkey. This is a satirical take on political figures and the idea of hidden agendas behind seemingly innocent leaders.

list.name: Martínez
list.about: In the episode 'The Whirly Dirly Conspiracy,' Martínez is a passenger on the Whirly Dirly roller coaster ride. When he is shot by Rick, his body begins to regenerate, revealing that he is an alien with regenerative abilities. This showcases the diverse and unexpected nature of characters in the Rick and Morty universe.

list.name: Marvin
list.about: Marvin, also known as the 'Man With Muscles Like Bricks,' is a superhero from the episode 'Vindicators 3: The Return of Worldender.' His superpower is having muscles that are as hard as bricks, giving him incredible strength. This character parodies traditional superheroes and their often simplistic powers.

list.name: Jackey
list.about: Jackey is a character from the episode 'Interdimensional Cable 2: Tempting Fate.' He is the host of 'Jan Quadrant Vincent 16' and is constantly plagued by accidents and mishaps during the show. This highlights the absurdity and unpredictable nature of interdimensional television in the Rick and Morty universe.

list.name: Native Alien
list.about: The Native Alien is a member of an alien tribe encountered by Rick and Morty in the episode 'Raising Gazorpazorp.' This alien species has a unique reproductive system where males give birth to live young through their anuses. This bizarre concept is a humorous take on gender roles and reproductive biology.

list.name: Pilgrim Alien
list.about: The Pilgrim Alien is a character from the episode 'Get Schwifty.' He is an alien who disguises himself as a human pilgrim and participates in a giant musical performance to save Earth. This character represents the strange and unexpected allies that Rick and Morty encounter in their adventures.

list.name: President Turkey
list.about: President Turkey is a character from the episode 'The Rickchurian Mortydate.' He is a turkey who becomes the President of the United States in an alternate dimension. This satirical portrayal comments on the absurdity of politics and the idea that anyone, even a turkey, can become a leader.

list.name: Mary-Lou
list.about: Mary-Lou is a character from the episode 'Total Rickall.' She is a memory parasite who disguises herself as a sweet, innocent girl to infiltrate the Smith family's memories. This episode explores the theme of trust and the difficulty of distinguishing between real and fake memories.

list.name: Big Fat Rick
list.about: Big Fat Rick is a character from the episode 'Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind.' He is a version of Rick who is significantly larger and overweight. This character showcases the infinite possibilities of different Ricks and their physical appearances in the multiverse.

list.name: Hothead Rick
list.about: Hothead Rick is a character from the episode 'Rest and Ricklaxation.' He represents the suppressed anger and aggression within Rick's psyche. This character symbolizes the emotional complexities of Rick's personality and the volatile nature of his inner thoughts.

list.name: Ricardo Montoya
list.about: Ricardo Montoya is a character from the episode 'The Rickchurian Mortydate.' He is a skilled agent of the Galactic Federation and engages in a fight sequence with Rick. The character's name is a reference to Ricardo Montalbán, a renowned actor known for his role in 'Fantasy Island.'

list.name: Wrap-it-up Little Rick
list.about: Wrap-it-up Little Rick is a character from the episode 'Interdimensional Cable 2: Tempting Fate.' He is a talk show host who urges his guests to wrap up their conversations quickly. This character satirizes the time constraints and pressure to entertain in television shows.

list.name: Yo-yo Rick
list.about: Yo-yo Rick is a character from the episode 'Rest and Ricklaxation.' He represents the aspect of Rick's personality that is fixated on performing impressive tricks with a yo-yo. This character symbolizes the desire for validation and attention-seeking behavior that exists within Rick's psyche.

list.name: Voiceoverian
list.about: The Voiceoverians are a species of aliens introduced in the episode 'Mortynight Run.' They communicate solely through voice-over narration and provide exposition for the events happening around them. This unique characteristic adds a meta-narrative element to the episode and humorously plays with storytelling conventions.

list.name: Voiceoverian
list.about: The Voiceoverians are a species of aliens introduced in the episode 'Mortynight Run.' They communicate solely through voice-over narration and provide exposition for the events happening around them. This unique characteristic adds a meta-narrative element to the episode and humorously plays with storytelling conventions.

list.name: Gotron Pilot
list.about: The Gotron Pilots are characters from the episode 'Rickmurai Jack.' They are warriors who pilot giant robotic mechs called Gotrons. This episode is a parody of the 'Power Rangers' and similar team-based superhero shows, showcasing the fusion of different pop culture references in Rick and Morty.

list.name: Gotron Pilot
list.about: The Gotron Pilots are characters from the episode 'Rickmurai Jack.' They are warriors who pilot giant robotic mechs called Gotrons. This episode is a parody of the 'Power Rangers' and similar team-based superhero shows, showcasing the fusion of different pop culture references in Rick and Morty.

list.name: Gotron Pilot

This episode is a parody of the 'Power Rangers' and similar team-based superhero shows, showcasing the fusion of different pop culture references in Rick and Morty.

list.name: Young Memory Rick
list.about: Young Memory Rick is a version of Rick Sanchez seen in the episode 'Rattlestar Ricklactica.' He appears in a memory sequence where he experiences a traumatizing event. This character emphasizes the complex and troubled history of Rick's past and his ability to access and manipulate memories.

list.name: Memory Tammy
list.about: Memory Tammy is a character from the episode 'Rattlestar Ricklactica.' She is a memory construct of Tammy Guetermann, a former love interest of Birdperson who was revealed to be an undercover agent for the Galactic Federation. Memory Tammy serves as a reminder of past betrayals and the dangers of trust in the show.
